CatDescriptText: Arthur H. Sherwood Jr., unemployed, Carrick and Grace Swindell, housewife, Bedford Dwellings were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 24, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe there should be another Negro judge in the local state courts - Allegheny County Court and the Common Pleas Court of Allegheny County?"  Mr. Sherwood's answer reads: "I believe there should be.  Such an appointment would help the Negroes in many ways."  Mrs. Swindell's answer reads: "Yes, I do, and for one reason it would be better for the colored race as a whole."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Arthur H. Sherwood Jr. wearing sweater with stand up collar, standing with hands behind back in front of window with neon sign for Grant Bar Sandwich Shop, Grant Street, Downtown; Portrait of Grace Swindell wearing circle and square patterned button down shirt, standing in front of light colored tile wall
